title.narrative: IR 4.5 PROMOTION DES DROITS DES ENFANTS

description.narrative: IR4.5: Policy makers at the national, provincial and community levels are involved in the rights of children, and the children are aware of their rights (survival, development, protection and participation) and promote them in their environment., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILDREN RIGHTS ENABLING ENVIRONMENTPCR4 : By the end of 2018, laws, social policies, planning, budgets, expenditures, public opinion and social norms are informed by ongoing analysis of the situation of children, monitoring and evaluation and promote an environment conducive to the full-implementation of children's rights

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: IR4.5: Policy makers at the national, provincial and community levels are involved in the rights of children, and the childrenare aware of their rights (survival, development, protection and participation) and promote them in their environment.

description.narrative: In 2019, UNICEF provided technical assistance to a selected number of national and provincial authorities and society organizations to train 9,046 adolescents in five cities (Kinshasa, Goma, Lubumbashi, Kananga and Mbandaka) on their rights and how to activate them. This effort contributed to an increase in the number of young reporters, child rights advocates – reaching 940, including 110 additional young reporters enrolled in 2019. Community level engagement of youth reporters has resulted in the ratification of 356 commitments. In 2019, 2 new provincial children's committees were established. A total of 5 children's committees are now operational across the country. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
